image.altText: Police tape strung from a van's rear vision mirror at the scene of a shooting.

props.synopsis: A man is in custody, and a 17-year-old boy is in a critical but stable condition after being shot in Hobart overnight.

title.children: Man in custody after 17-year-old shot in South Hobart

image.altText: People gathering at a big colourful music and food festival.

props.synopsis: A federal assistant minister and two Tasmanian state Labor MPs apologise after a complaint was made about their behaviour at the Taste of Summer festival in Hobart.

title.children: Assistant minister for women apologises for 'shoot, shag or marry' game at festival

image.altText: A thief in a light-coloured hoodie holds a hammer and smashes a glass cabinet.

props.synopsis: For years, a prestigious trophy that represented Australia's ties to Italian high fashion took pride of place in a Tasmanian museum. But it is now missing after a 'targeted' overnight robbery.

title.children: Mystery grips village after 'priceless' trophy fleeced from museum

image.altText: A pole with a large camera elevated above a bushland area in rural Tasmania.

props.synopsis: As fire crews were responding to two fires on Tasmania's east coast in December, an AI camera nestled in a nearby vantage point spotted a third blaze. The early detection meant the fire was extinguished just two hours later.

title.children: Firefighters were tackling a blaze when a camera alerted them to an unseen threat

image.altText: An electronic billboard about 'The Very Hungry Wall'.

props.synopsis: A concrete wall built on the picturesque waterfront of a small Tasmanian town has prompted confusion and concern from residents.

title.children: A Tasmanian council built a wall. It hasn't gone down well

image.altText: Rose Byrne smiles with a Golden GLobe

props.synopsis: Australian actor Rose Byrne wins a Golden Globe for her performance in If I Had Legs I'd Kick You, while Jacob Elordi misses out for Frankenstein. Follow live.

title.children: Rose Byrne wins first Golden Globe, Jacob Elordi and Sarah Snook miss out

image.altText: Dozens of protesters hold up an 'Abolish ICE' banner as they march in front of Trump Tower.

props.synopsis: US Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem says hundreds more federal agents are heading to Minneapolis, brushing aside demands by the city's Democratic leaders to leave after an immigration officer fatally shot a female protester.

title.children: Trump admin sending more agents to Minneapolis despite outrage over fatal shooting

image.altText: A person with their face covered holds a sign that reads 'abolish ice'

props.synopsis: Minneapolis had been the target of a massive immigration enforcement operation in the weeks leading up to Renee Nicole Good's death. Now, the shooting has opened old wounds.

title.children: 'These ICE agents are here for sport': Why immigration agents surged into Minneapolis

image.altText: piles of rubbish, tents and misc camping equipment on a large patch of grass

props.synopsis: With campsite trash accounting for more than half of the rubbish accumulated at music festivals, there are calls for a "cultural shift" in the behaviour of those attending.

title.children: Walking through post-festival camp full of abandoned gear feels like 'shopping'

image.altText: Protesters gather as vehicles burn, amid evolving anti-government unrest

props.synopsis: The US-based Human Rights Activists News Agency says a further 10,600 people have been arrested as Iran's theocratic government attempts to crack down on the demonstrations.

title.children: At least 500 killed in Iran protests as Trump weighs intervention

image.altText: A sign for Woolworths on top of another for Coles

props.synopsis: US Federal Reserve chief Jerome Powell confirms he is facing a Department of Justice investigation, while Australia's competition watchdog will use new powers to go after the big supermarkets, according to a report.

title.children: ACCC reportedly to sue Coles, Woolies as US Fed chair faces criminal probe

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Greenback continues to fall on Powell criminal investigation
Rare earths rally ahead of G7 meeting
Parcel delivery service Sendle stops delivering

image.altText: flooding over road

props.synopsis: Authorities have issued a Flood Emergency Warning for the central Queensland town of Clermont as large parts of the state are on flood watch in the wake of ex-Tropical Cyclone Koji.

title.children: Flood Emergency Warning for central Qld town as ex-Cyclone Koji moves inland

image.altText: A graphic of a female athlete throwing a javelin with a dollar sign on it

props.synopsis: Low pay, discrimination, disordered eating, sexism and online abuse are just a few of the prevalent issues ABC's Elite Athletes in Women's Sport Survey has revealed, despite recent progress in women's sport.

title.children: Elite sportswomen have shared their stories, and these are the hard truths

image.altText: A man in a light purple apron and a black t-shirt stirs sliced onions in a saucepan on a stovetop.

props.synopsis: If you're a food lover, chances are you've heard of the Michelin Guide – you may have even dined at a Michelin-starred restaurant, but not here in Australia.

title.children: Why there are no Michelin-starred restaurants in Australia

image.altText: Two white Wegovy prescription medicine boxes seen on a turquoise surface.

props.synopsis: The cost of weight loss drug Wegovy will soon be massively subsidised for Australians with severe obesity who have had a stroke or heart attack.

title.children: Ozempic-like drug to be listed on PBS for people with severe obesity

image.altText: Image of strips of paper scrunched into the shape of a brain. The paper says words like "stress" and "anxiety".

props.synopsis: Everyone experiences intrusive thoughts, and most people can brush them off without a worry. But what happens when those intrusive thoughts become inescapable?

title.children: How 'hidden thoughts' can be a sign of OCD in some people

image.altText: A scientist with a microscope.

props.synopsis: When Queen Elizabeth II used a product on her royal tour of Australia in 1963, journalists noticed. Then everyone wanted to use it.

title.children: The Aussie invention made famous by Queen Elizabeth II

image.altText: A pole with a large camera elevated above a bushland area in rural Tasmania.

props.synopsis: As fire crews were responding to two fires on Tasmania's east coast in December, an AI camera nestled in a nearby vantage point spotted a third blaze. The early detection meant the fire was extinguished just two hours later.

title.children: Firefighters were tackling a blaze when a camera alerted them to an unseen threat

image.altText: More than two-thousand people attended a vigil for the Bondi shooting victims,

props.synopsis: More than 2,000 people attended a vigil for the Bondi shooting victim at the Bondi Pavilion, marking the end of the Jewish period of mourning.

title.children: Waltzing Matilda tribute for youngest victim of the Bondi shooting

image.altText: The symbol for meta is sitting on top of a computer keyboard.

props.synopsis: More than half a million Australian children have been kicked off Facebook and Instagram by Meta to comply with Australia's social media ban for under-16s.

title.children: Meta kicks 550,000 children off platforms to comply with social media ban

image.altText: Donald Trump speaking into a microphone while holding up his hand.

props.synopsis: The US is enforcing a strict oil blockade on Venezuela, the communist country's main supplier of oil, as the Trump administration continues to push Latin American countries to align with it.

title.children: Trump tells Cuba to 'make a deal' as US cuts off Venezuelan oil

image.altText: A woman in a green top with pandanus trees in the background

props.synopsis: Australia's domestic violence commissioner and local legal services have raised concerns about women's safety at Katherine Local Court, saying urgent upgrades are needed to protect victim-survivors.

title.children: Women forced to discuss DV cases in public at 'unsafe' outback court

image.altText: Woman with bob haircut sits on a purple chair in an empty doctor waiting room.

props.synopsis: The percentage of GP clinics fully bulk-billing has almost doubled, according to a new report, however, the government says the data cannot be relied on.

title.children: Bulk-billing rates have almost doubled, report indicates

image.altText: People gathering at a big colourful music and food festival.

props.synopsis: A federal assistant minister and two Tasmanian state Labor MPs apologise after a complaint was made about their behaviour at the Taste of Summer festival in Hobart.

title.children: Assistant minister for women apologises for 'shoot, shag or marry' game at festival

image.altText: A main street with two graphics of a KFC sign and a McDonald's sign on either side of the image.

props.synopsis: Nutrition, vibe and culture concerns fuel these communities that want to protect their suburbs' identity and businesses from the fast food giants.

title.children: 'We can't survive it': The suburbs fighting against fast food giants

image.altText: A close up photo of a white car with the word "police" written in blue over the bonnet and blue and white checks on the side.

props.synopsis: Police are investigating reports of an Islamic community leader being assaulted after he and his wife were forced off the road by a vehicle and racially abused in Dandenong South.

title.children: Muslim leader and wife allegedly abused, assaulted in Melbourne

image.altText: Images of blue and white checkered police tape stretched across a suburban street.

props.synopsis: A man allegedly carrying a vest covered in duct-taped objects in Bondi has been arrested and charged by NSW Police, with his vest examined by the bomb disposal unit and deemed safe.

title.children: Man allegedly in duct tape vest charged with offensive conduct in Bondi

image.altText: A dilapidated weatherboard cottage with torn black plastic covering one outer wall.

props.synopsis: A report obtained by the ABC under Freedom of Information shows a port authority not only failed to prevent a heritage-listed building from deteriorating, but likely made things worse.

title.children: Report reveals ongoing damage, neglect of historic WA homestead

image.altText: A politician with a stack of media papers walks into a media scrum on a street

props.synopsis: Independent MP Nick McBride, who is currently on home detention bail for the alleged assault of his wife, could receive around $100,000 in public funding to support his re-election campaign, according to the state's electoral commission.

title.children: Taxpayers could foot $100k bill for assault-accused MP's re-election bid

image.altText: Aryna Sabalenka kisses a trophy

props.synopsis: Aryna Sabalenka has won yet another title on Australian soil, showing that the Australian Open is hers for the taking.

title.children: Strength is Sabalenka's superpower, but variety will win her the AO

image.altText: Iga Swiatek shouts during a match for Poland in the United Cup.

props.synopsis: After two losses at the United Cup over the weekend, world number two Iga Świątek insists "everything is fine" with her fitness in the lead-up to the Australian Open.

title.children: 'Super sore' Iga Świątek plays down fitness concerns on Australian Open eve

image.altText: Adelaide Strikers wicketkeeper Alex Carey hugs his daughter on the field before a Big Bash League game. His son stands nearby.

props.synopsis: After a sensational Ashes series, Alex Carey returns to Adelaide and the Big Bash with a bang, although it was a tougher night out for his daughter, Clementine.

title.children: Alex Carey pulls dad duty on explosive return to BBL

image.altText: A young man with orange hair stands with his arms on his chest looking ahead.

props.synopsis: A Brisbane mum was worried about what her son would do after high school, so she created a transition program to help other neurodivergent young adults.

title.children: How this mum is getting young neurodivergent students jobs

image.altText: A service station bain marie with a selection of fried food.

props.synopsis: The latest WA Health and Wellbeing report reveals how regions stack up when it comes to things like diet, smoking, exercise and mental health.

title.children: Two WA regions well below average when it comes to eating enough veggies

image.altText: A close up photo of Peter Mandelson speaking.

props.synopsis: Peter Mandelson, who was fired as the UK's ambassador in Washington DC over his ties to the convicted sex offender, has apologised to victims of Jeffrey Epstein "for a system that refused to hear their voices".

title.children: Former UK diplomat says he did not know about Epstein abuse
